title: W3.CSSTooltips

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSSTooltips with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Hover over the sentences below: London ( 9 million inhabitants ) is the capital of England. London 9 million inhabitants is the capital of England. W3.CSS Tooltip Classes W3.CSS provides the following tooltip classes: Class Defines w3-tooltip The tooltip element w3-text The tooltip text Tooltip Element and Tooltip Text Tooltips display text (or other content) when you hover over an HTML element. The w3-tooltip class defines the element to hover over (the tooltip container). The w3-text class defines the tooltip text. Hover over the sentence below: London ( 9 million inhabitants ) is the capital of England. Example

London (9 million inhabitants) is the capital of England.

Tooltip as a Tag Hover over the sentence below: London 9 million inhabitants is the capital of England. Example

London 9 million inhabitants is the capital of England.

Image Tooltip Hover over this picture to see the effect: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation. Most definitions of the term specify that cars typically have four wheels.(Wikipedia) Example (text before the picture)

A car is a...

Example (text after the picture)

A car is a...

Absolute Positioned Tooltip If you want the tooltip to appear in an absolute position, position the tooltip text with CSS: London 9 million inhabitants is the capital of England. Example

London 9 million inhabitants is the capital of England.

Colored Tooltip If you want a colored tooltip, use the w3- color classes: Example 9 million inhabitants Rounded Tooltip If you want a rounded tooltip, use the w3- round classes: Example 9 million inhabitants Small Tooltip If you want a small tooltip, use the w3-small class: Example 9 million inhabitants Tiny Tooltip If you want a tiny tooltip, use the w3-tiny class: Example 9 million inhabitants Large Tooltip If you want a large tooltip, use the w3- large classes: Example 9 million inhabitants Animated Tooltip If you want to fade in the tooltip, use the w3-animate-opacity class: Example 9 million inhabitants ★ +1

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is million inhabitants?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of million inhabitants is 'the capital of England'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSSTooltips concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSSTooltips effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSSTooltips and how to apply it in your projects.
